resources.string: Perfect Ingress Glyph Hacking: Catch incoming Glyphs and replace outgoing with them
This Xposed module is to be used for Niantic\'s augmented reality game Ingress. It won\'t help you without the game.
It seems that Xglyph² is not activated in the Xposed installer. Activate it and reboot.
Xglyph² is an Xposed module. It seems that you don\'t have the Xposed Framework installed. The module won\'t work without the framework.
Xglyph² has only been tested on Android 6 Marshmallow and earlier versions. It\'s not guaranteed that the module works on newer Android versions.
It seems that you don\'t have a Bitcoin wallet installed.\nIf you want to get started with Bitcoin, I recommend Mycelium.
Tap the orange section headers to get a description
Activate the module independent of the Xposed Installer. You don\'t have to restart the device, but you have to restart Ingress to take effect.
Catch incoming glyphs and replace outgoing with them. You have to draw all glyphs, but mistakes don\'t matter.
Hack a key, even when using the Hack No Key option in the circle menu. Of course you can only get a key if you don\'t already have one.
Hack no key, even when using the Hack option in the circle menu or the Hack button in the portal dialog.

Send correct glyphs, even when tapping bypass. If you tap bypass too early, particularly when the glyphs aren\'t loaded yet, the glyph game will be bypassed as usual.\n\nTHIS IS A VERY UGLY CHEAT, DON\'T USE THIS PERMANENTLY!
Configure the speed bonus you get when hitting bypass. This doesn\'t affect the speed bonus when playing the glyph game normal.
Automatically send a \'MORE\' glyph to request a key, even when you don\'t touch the command glyph or draw bullshit.
Automatically send a \'LESS\' glyph to request no key, even when you don\'t touch the command glyph or draw bullshit.
Automatically send a \'COMPLEX\' glyph to speed up the glyph sequence prompt. You have to touch the command glyph interface to trigger this!
Automatically send a \'SIMPLE\' glyph to slow down the glyph sequence prompt. You have to touch the command glyph interface to trigger this!

If you draw a correct 'MORE' or 'LESS' command glyph, it overrides the Glyph Hack Key configuration.
And if you draw a correct 'COMPLEX' or 'SIMPLE' command glyph, it overrides the Glyph Hack Speed configuration.
If you touch the very top dot of the command glyph interface, the glyph speed is set to normal, ignoring the Glyph Hack Speed configuration.
Key and speed overriding are also combinable.
Show/hide debug log in Xposed. You can check the log either in the Xposed Installer or using adb.

It took pretty long to create Xglyph², the functionality, as well as the interface.

Donations are very welcome! :-)

You can use Bitcoin to make a donation. If you don't have a Bitcoin wallet yet, I recommend Mycelium. You can find it on the Google Play Store.
Activate module independent of Xposed Installer
Catch incoming glyphs and replace outgoing with them
If you like my work, feel free to donate
